projects.title: Thrust Vectoring Feasibility Study of a Civil Aircraft
projects.description:
This project culminates the studies of the undergraduate program in the Aerospace Engineering department of the class of 2013 at the UT-Arlington. 

The project consisted of Implementing thrust vectoring technology to a commercial aircraft (Boeing 737) and the ability of the aircraft to flight unstable with Controls Configure Vehicle configuration. This was conducted in order to meet the NASA N+3 goals to reduce pollution, fuel consumption, and increase performance. The focus of the project was base on the conceptual design phase where a feasibility study was perform in order to quantify the performance gains from implementing TVC and CCV to a commercial aircraft.

Different teams were assemble in order to analyze each engineering discipline aerodynamics, propulsion, structure, stability and control, performance, risk assessment, certification, CAD, and cost. My task as a propulsion specialists and forecaster for future technology in the group was to developed a TVC engine and research future technology that could be implemented into the commercial aircraft.

projects.title: Senior Design I ( Reverse Engineering of MESSERSCHMITT BF 109 )
projects.description: The project consisted of reverse engineering the WWII fighter aircraft from every aspect and discipline. The team consisted of sixteen people and groups were compose of those members into each discipline. My task in the group was stability & control of the aircraft. The purpose of the project was to see how the plane was able to fly and perform during the war and to reproduce a flying scenario to match its performance. Also, to see if the plane would fly today and if it would be certified by the FAA certifications. The cost of building the plane would also be taking into account in today’s economy and during the period of time it was being mass-produced.

projects.title: Flight Performance (Sky Diver Analysis & Wet Suit)
projects.description:
The desing project studies the motions of two specific cases of a man jumping out of plane and the other gliding with the use of a wingsuit. During the trajectory of the first part of the desing project a diver jumps out of plane at an alitutde of 15,000 ft. Druing this period of flight his altitude were terminal velocity is obtain and the different forces acting on the diver have to be produced. Also, sketches of the forces and moments acting on the diver during the jump and as the diver reaches its terminal velocity have to be produce. The drag and Reynolds number have to be calculated for this portion of the project. 

The second part of the assignment is to calculate the wetted area, drag area, the max drag at a 90 degree angle that is produced. Also to produced plots for both the L/D from 0 degrees to 90 and lift and drag for the same range of angles. Also, sketches are to be made of the wing suit and pilot. Anohter criteria is to find how is the wing suit producing longitudinal stability and to quantify the performance for the suit. The desing element for the project arrives from the freedom to choose on how to solve each problem and the assumptions that one takes to accommodate for difficulties.

volunteer_experiences.description: DME Exchange of Dallas is an organization dedicated to recycling durable medical equipment for those in need. My role is to service, repair and sanitize donated medical equipment. Then the medical equipment is donated to a person in need with no charge. The only thing ask is that if the equipment is no longer needed to be return back to DME so it can be service and donated again.

I participated as a judge in the CoCo Best Robotic competition. This competition is sponsored by Raytheon and other partners. It was compose of many different teams from middle school to high school. The teams were responsible to build a robot and compete for the BEST award. As a judge I was responsible to grade each team base on their engineering notebooks, oral presentations, methodology and creativity. Also, I volunteer for event set up and other activities through the two day event

Mentoring its a great experience not only you get to teach the children but you also learn from them. As a mentor I work with the kids on several aspects such as farming, math, science, english and team work.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer/ responsible for safety and care for wild cats
volunteer_experiences.description: My volunteer experience was rewarding at In-Sync Exotics I learn so much from helping the animals in need of assistance and care. Giving back to such a cause and spending time there change the way I though of a wildcat. I learn to work as a team in different settings than normal situations and safety guidelines, procedures when dealing with tigers. As well as an environment were team cooperation and self composure were require.

At the mission of Arlington I was lucky to be in a position to help those in need of food, shelter and other basic needs. I spend time with other volunteers organizing donations, preparing food, delivered donated items to families in need and teaching basic writing and reading skills to those in need.
